summary.para: Adds the ability to do the same as lock(...) { } but for async Tasks and awaits
This lock uses the lightweight semaphore slim to prevent any chance of a deadlock.

member.name: F:Cored.Async.AsyncLock.SelfLock
member.summary: A semaphore to lock the semaphore list

member.summary: Awaits for any outstanding tasks to complete that are accessing the same key, then runs the given task, returning its value.

member.param: The task to perform inside the semaphore lock
Sets the maximum number of tasks that can access this task before waiting

summary.para: Provides a thread-safe mechanism for starting and stopping the execution of a task that can only have one instance of itself running regardless of the amount of times start/stop is called and from what thread.
Supports cancellation request via the and the given task will be provided with a cancellation token to monitor for when it should "stop"

member.name: F:Cored.Tasks.SingleTaskWorker.WorkerFinishedEvent
member.summary: A flag indicating if the worker task is still running.

member.name: F:Cored.Tasks.SingleTaskWorker.CancellationToken
member.summary: The token used to cancel any ongoing work in order to shutdown

member.name: P:Cored.Tasks.SingleTaskWorker.LockingKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a unique ID for locking the starting and stopping calls of this class

member.name: P:Cored.Tasks.SingleTaskWorker.WorkerName
member.summary: Gets The name that identifies the worker (used in unhandled exception logs to report source of an issue)

member.name: P:Cored.Tasks.SingleTaskWorker.Stopping
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the service is shutting down, and whether it should finish what it's doing and save any important information or progress.

member.name: P:Cored.Tasks.SingleTaskWorker.IsRunning
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the main worker task is running

member.name: M:Cored.Tasks.SingleTaskWorker.StartAsync
member.summary: Starts the given task running if it is not already running

member.name: M:Cored.Tasks.SingleTaskWorker.StopAsync
member.summary: Requests that the given task should stop running, and waits for it to finish

member.name: M:Cored.Tasks.SingleTaskWorker.RunWorkerTaskNoAwait
member.summary: Runs the worker task and sets the IsRunning to false once complete
member.returns: Return once the worker task has completed

member.summary: The task that will be run by this worker

member.name: T:Cored.Web.ConnectivityChecker
member.summary: Continually hits up a web HTTP/HTTPS endpoint at a specified interval, checking for a valid response This is particularly helpful for checking the connectivity of a website.

member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether the class is disposing.

member.name: P:Cored.Web.ConnectivityChecker.Responsive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the endpoint is responsive

member.name: M:Cored.Web.ConnectivityChecker.PingAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpClient,System.String,System.Func{System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Hits up a web HTTP/HTTPS endpoint once to determine whether the endpoint is active, just like a ping does.
member.param: The endpoint to do a get call on
If specified, handles whether the from the server should be classified as successful or not.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the endpoint is active

member.name: M:Cored.Web.ConnectivityChecker.LinearRetryAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpClient,System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.Action{System.Boolean},System.Func{System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Hits up a web HTTP/HTTPS endpoint continually at a given interval to determine whether the server is responsive.
member.param: The endpoint to do a GET call on
The time between periodical checks in milliseconds
Fired when the endpoint state changes (responsive/not responsive)
If specified, handles whether the from the server should be classified as successful or not.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the endpoint is active

member.name: M:Cored.Web.ConnectivityChecker.ExponentialRetryAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpClient,System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.Action{System.Boolean},System.Func{System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Hits up a web HTTP/HTTPS endpoint continually at a given interval to determine whether the server is responsive.
member.param: The endpoint to do a GET call on
The time between periodical checks in milliseconds
Fired when the endpoint state changes (responsive/not responsive)
If specified, handles whether the from the server should be classified as successful or not.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the endpoint is active

member.summary: Send a GET request to an URL and returns the raw http web response
member.remarks: IMPORTANT: Remember to close the returned stream once done
member.param: The URL to make the request to
The format to deserialize the content of the response into.
Allows caller to customize and configure the request prior to the request being sent
Provides the Authorization header with 'bearer token-here' for things like JWT bearer tokens

member.param: The URL to make the request to
The expected type of content to be returned from the server
Allows caller to customize and configure the request prior to the content being written and sent
Provides the Authorization header with 'Bearer {token}' for JWT bearer tokens
